Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Souvenir \Sou`ve*nir\ (? or ?), n. [F., fr. souvenir to remember, fr. L. subvenire to come up, come to mind; sub under + venire to come, akin to E. come. See {Come}, and cf. {Subvention}.] That which serves as a reminder; a remembrancer; a memento; a keepsake. [1913 Webster]
souvenir n 1: something of sentimental value [syn: {keepsake}, {token}, {relic}] 2: a reminder of past events [syn: {memento}]
